property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." - Noise

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Click] Host Pawn at the outermost ICE of a server||Move pawn to targeted ICE directly after the current ICE hosting Pawn||Trash Pawn and install a Caissa program from your Grip||Trash Pawn and install a Caissa program from your Heap||The Exile Combo (Use only if you know what you're doing)

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: onPlay[Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip.|-|Search your stack for a connection and install it paying all costs.]

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever the Corp spends a [Click] to draw 1 card or gain 1 [Credits] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1. [Click], [Trash]: Gain 1 [Credits] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What if this ice wants to be free?" - Rielle "Kit" Peddler

property.name: Rules
property.value: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Normal people-sane people- do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, of the ever-popular lust for money? - Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

property.name: Rules
property.value: The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card. The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Who wants to start a war?

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Code Gate-NEXT

property.name: Rules
property.value: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2 [Credits] for each card revealed.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ. [Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of deja vu.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: 1 [Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.||[Subroutine] End the run.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." - The Professor

property.name: Rules
property.value: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives into R&D.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Click]: Draw 2 cards.||Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives into R&D.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Double-Gray Ops

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Trace2 - If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7 [Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity. Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the runner pays 3 [Credits]." for each advancement token on it.

property.name: Instructions
property.value: [Subroutine] Trash Target Program||Runner loses 3 credits per advancement token

property.name: Faction
property.value: The Weyland Consortium

property.name: Rules
property.value: Purge virus counters.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Your free trial has expired. Upgrade to the full version?

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Grim of legend was one of may so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." - The Professor
